oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Southern Serenaders performances - tape 3 - 1950-02-21
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 3 of various performances on the Red Pleasant and his Southern Serenaders radio show featuring the Southern Serenaders (performers), as well as Eddy Arnold (performer) and Hank Williams (performer) on February 21 and 22, 1950 on radio station WSLI (Jackson, Miss.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Southern Serenaders; Eddy Arnold; Hank Williams
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- If Brother Jack Were Here (Eddy Arnold) -- Eddy Arnold talks -- Hank Williams introduces the next tune -- Lost High (Hank Williams, Southern Serenaders) -- Hank Williams talks -- [Unidentified] talks about the Southern Serenaders on future shows -- [Unidentified] introduces Hank Williams and the Southern Serenaders -- Long Gone Daddy (Hank Williams, Southern Serenaders) -- Hank Williams talks about some of his hit songs -- Hank Williams introduces the next tune -- Hank Williams talks -- Long Gone Lonesome Blues (Hank Williams, Southern Serenaders) [plays at varying speeds] -- Long Gone Lonesome Blues (Hank Williams, Southern Serenaders) -- Hank Williams talks -- Long Gone Lonesome Blues (Hank Williams, Southern Serenaders) (incomplete) [plays at varying speeds]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Southern Serenaders; Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008; Williams, Hank, 1923-1953;
